question: “Since Indians wish to unite and develop a common culture, it is the bounden duty of all Indians to own up Hindi as their language… Any Indian who does not accept this proposal…, has no right to be Indian.” Who among the following said this?
explanation: Maker of Indian Constitution and chairman of the Drafting Committee of the constitution Dr. B.R. Ambedkar said, in the constituent Assembly of India, that “Since Indians wish to write and develop a common culture, it is the bounden duty of all Indians to own up Hindi as their language.........Any Indian who does not accept this proposal....., has no right to be Indian.”
